properties.sfomuseum:creditline: Gift of the San Francisco Aeronautical Society
properties.sfomuseum:description_library: 1 volume (unpaged, accordion folded) : color illustrations ; 28 cm
properties.sfomuseum:dimensions: 11 x 7 x 2 inches (27.9 x 17.8 x 5.1 cm)
properties.sfomuseum:notes_library: Author: This double-sided accordion book uses the paper airplane as a metaphor for the pursuit of flight. The book was inspired by vultures soaring and pelicans gliding at Stinson Beach, California, as well as by David McCulloughâ€™s superb book, The Wright Brothers.FLIGHT is a limited edition of 30 copies, completed in the fall of 2017. Charles Hobson wrote the text and created pastel monotypes and drawings for the front and back of book which have been reproduced as high-resolution digital prints. The typeface is Adobe Garamond and the text has been printed on stained paper created with an acrylic wash. Each book contains five folded paper airplanes fitted into pop-up tabs. The tabs have been reinforced with Tyvek and the planes are printed on Hammermill 20 lb Great White 30 acid free paper. The facing pages of the accordion are printed on Coronado SST 80 lb Stipple paper and the backing pages are Graystone Classic Linen. Charles Hobson designed the edition and John DeMerritt editioned the covers and the drop leaf boxes. The accordion itself was assembled by Charles Hobson with the assistance of Alice Shaw and the 150 paper airplanes were folded with the assistance of Anna Rauh.Limited edition of 30 copies, signed and numbered by the artist.Issued in a blue linen-covered solander box with tooled title in silver on spine."FLIGHT has been made as a limited edition of 30 copies, completed in the fall of 2017. Charles Hobson wrote the text and created pastel monotypes for the edition which have been reproduced as high-resolution digital prints. The typeface is Adobe Garamond and the text has been printed on stained paper created with an acrylic wash. Each book contains five folded paper airplanes fitted into pop-up tabs. The tabs have been reinforced with Tyvek and the planes are printed on Hammermill 20 lb Great White 30 acid free paper. The facing pages of the accordion are printed on Coronado SST 80 lb Stipple paper and the backing pages are Greystone Classic Linen. Charles Hobson designed the edition and John Demerritt editioned the binding. The accordion has been assembled by Charles Hobson with the assistance of Alice Shaw and the 150 paper airplanes have been folded with the assistance of Anna Rauh."--Colophon."What bird did they watch? As would be expected each aspiring aviator was transfixed by the flight of a bird. The bird, in each case, was different. In the following pages the bird that captivated the man is pictured and the details about its species have been described."--Page [1] of the facing pages of the accordion.
